column4: Okay I've got a little problem...I can't boot my windows anymore... I installed ubuntu but I'm not sure if it fully installed so I just deleted its partition and well now when I go to boot my pc it says :A disk read error..press ctrl alt del to restart.
lol yeah Bluhd...it is..well I can see the files when I boot ubuntu  live thingy. but it just wont boot
Put your XP cd in and boot to the Windows recovery console, and type FIXBOOT press enter then type FIXMBR
Doesn't matter, when you boot off the cd it will ask you to press r to enter the recovery console
FIXMBR will be the command that fixes your problem
You deleted your ubuntu partition so don't worry about Grup
did you have to type in a password?
Did the error occur when you typed FIXMBR?
try it again running FIXMBR followed by FIXBOOT
I would suggest reinstalling Windows without formating
where you pressed r before press enter
then the license agreement will come up and you can just press f8
then DO NOT install a clean verison of XP instead it will ask if you want to repair by pressing r
Do that and you will not loose any of your apps or data
if that doesn't work then obviously a clean format and install will solve your problem
See how Linux keeps you coming back for more?
Well sorry it didn't work out for you
